description: Regular online self-test quizzes scheduled throughout the semester to provide feedback on understanding of course materials.

Two-part assessment: Part A involves participation in activities (clinic consultation, research project, online modules) and reflection; Part B is a group presentation analyzing ocular structure and evidence quality.
Multiple choice exam assessing knowledge of visual perception, evidence-based practices, and statistical methods, including tutorial work consolidation.
Multiple choice exam covering eye anatomy, visual perception, research methods, and statistics, including tutorial and laboratory work consolidation.
